Literature Review: The development of stem cell-based regenerative approaches for retinal degeneration has garnered significant attention in recent years due to the limited capacity of the mammalian retina to repair itself. The isolation and development of culture methods for human pluripotent stem cells, as well as the generation of induced pluripotent stem cells, have opened up new avenues for cell replacement therapies. However, the challenges associated with delivering stem cells to the retina, integrating them with the host circuitry, and overcoming the recipient's immunological microenvironment remain significant hurdles to overcome.
